uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.classification
Interface Classifier

All Known Implementing Classes:
NaturalBreaks, SimpleClassifier, Quantile
public interface Classifier

Defines the Classifier interface. Once construced a classifer specified a set of bins into which numbers fit. Using the methods in this interface is is possible to find out which bin a given number falls into: When implementing this interface there are a number of things to remember. There must be no gaps in the range of values which the classifier suports. You must make sure that the largest value you want to include in the range of valid numbers is actualy included in the last bin of the range.

Version:
0.1
Author:
jamesm
See Also:
an example of an object which uses classifiers.

Method Detail

getBins

public com.sun.java.util.collections.List getBins()
The full set of bins provided by this classifer, in order from smallest to largest. There must be no overlap between bin ranges.
Returns:
A List containing all of the Bins for this classifier

getBin

public Bin getBin(int binNumber)
Get an individual bin by index number.
Parameters:
binNumber - The int index of the bin to retrive. Bins indexes start from 0 as the bin holding the smallest value.
Returns:
Bin, the requested bin.

getValidRange

public Bin getValidRange()
Gets the full range of values that this classifier can return a sane result for.
Returns:
Bin A special bin which specifies the full range of values which the classifier can sensibly handle.

classify

public int classify(double value)
Finds which bin the specided value falls into.
Parameters:
value - a double to classify by finding the approproate bin.
Returns:
the index of the Bin which holds the specified value. More infomration on the returned bin can be obtained by calling getBin(binNumber);

getBinCount

public int getBinCount()
Returns:
int The number of seperate bins in this classifier
